message:
A friend of mine who's trying to break into the indie market pointed out this blog to me:

http://whatgamesare.com/

Some interesting commentary on game design, as well as the games industry.
If you like metal, ever been curious about metal or want to know more about it and it's sub genres you owe it to yourself to check out this site http://mapofmetal.com/
That was surely inspired by Ishkur's Guide (which has been around forever and, by now, looks the part).
My friend pointed me to Team Meat's blog. Some interesting (and quite humorous) articles about game design for anyone interested. http://supermeatboy.com/tag/game%20design/

Edmund McMillen (one half of Team Meat) also has his own blog: http://edmundmcmillen.blogspot.com/ Current topic is The Binding of Isaac, which is a top-down shooter Zelda roguelike thing coming out next month.

This was a very interesting read: How they decyphered stuxnet:
http://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2011/07/how-digital-detectives-deciphered-stuxnet/all/1
Broken, that was a fascinating article.

This one is painful, but has to be seen:  “Fat, Ugly or Slutty” is a blog that archives sexist behaviour in online gaming communities:

http://fatuglyorslutty.com/
